Users: /api/users.GET: returns all of the users that are available in an array that have valid keys

Users: /api/users/:username.GET: returns all the information in the users table that have the same username primary key as the username

TOPICS: /api/topics.GET: returns all of the topics that are available in an array that have valid keys from the topics table

Articles: /api/articles.GET: returns all of the articles that are available in an array that have valid keys from the article table

Articles: /api/articles?.author: takes the query of authors and only serves up article that are written by that author, e.g. /api/articles?author=butter_bridge
Articles: /api/articles?.topic: take the query of topic and only serves up article that have that topic, e.g. /api/articles?topic=cats
Articles: /api/articles?.sort_by: takes the query of sort_by this defaults to created_at by can be changed to be sorted by any column e.g. /api/articles?sort_by=votes
Articles: /api/articles?.order: takes a query of order which is defaulted to descending by can be queried to ascending, e.g. /api/articles?order=desc
Articles: /api/articles?.chaining: query's can be chained together using && between them, e.g. /api/articles?sort_by=title&&order=asc

Articles: /api/articles/:article_id.GET: return the article that has the article_id as a parameter in the endpoint
Articles: /api/articles/:article_id.PATCH: updates the votes and allows them to be either incremented or decremented

Articles: /api/articles/:article_id/comm.GET: return all the comments that have the article_id
Articles: /api/articles/:article_id/comm.POST: adds a new comments to an article returning the comment that was added

Comments: /api/comments/:comment_id.PATCH: updates the votes and allows them to be either incremented or decremented
